citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult white guinea pig with gray ears in house 1, enclosure # 100 was observed with hair loss approximately 1/2 inch
in diameter on the left side of her nose.
A white & gray weanling guinea pig in house 1, enclosure # 13 was observed with hair loss with sore/scabs on the bridge
of it's nose approximately 1 inch in diameter.
Both animals appeared to be eating and drinking normally. The treatment for hair loss and ringworm is addressed in the
program of veterinary care. There is no record that the facility had identified these two animals prior to today's inspection.
Failure to conduct daily observations can result in delay of care provided to animals and prolong animal health problems.
All animals must be observed daily to assess their health and well-being with a mechanism of direct and frequent
communication with the attending veterinarian so that timely and accurate information on problems of animal health are
conveyed. The licensee must observed animas daily, identify guinea pigs with health issues, follow the program of
veterinary care on file approved by the attending veterinarian, document treatment, and communicate with the attending
veterinarian. Correct by April 8, 2023.

A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review. A total of 2629 adult guinea pigs, weanlings, and
newborns were counted during this inspection. There were no inventory records to indicate the number of adult guinea
pigs, weanlings, and newborns present since February. Failure to maintain these records can make it difficult to assess
the health of the caviary by identifying animal losses by death or decreased number of animals born and raised. The
facility must maintain records containing the required information for animals which fully and correctly disclose the number
of guinea pigs held, owned, acquired or disposed of including births and deaths. Correct by April 15, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section
